text: Baking the Cookies Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C) (175 C).  Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or line with aluminium foil and spray foil with nonstick cooking spray.  Add shortening and sugar to a mixing bowl. Cream ingredients until fluffy. Add egg to shortening mixture and beat well.  Add molasses and stir into shortening mixture.  Add the flour, baking soda, salt and spices to another mixing bowl. Mix dry ingredients together to combine. Add flour mixture to shortening mixture alternately with 1/2 cup (115 grams) water.  Use a teaspoon (5 grams) to drop cookie dough onto prepared baking sheets. Leave about 2 inches (5.1 cm) between each cookie to ensure they don't get stuck together while baking. Bake cookies 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow cookies to cool several minutes before removing cookies to a wire baking rack to cool. Remove baked cookies to wire cooling racks. Cool until the cookies are cold to the touch. Frosting the Cookies Mix powdered sugar with enough water to make a stiff but spreadable frosting.  Spread about 1/2 teaspoon (2.4 grams) frosting on each cookie top.
